title: 2 Simple Ways to Change Google Chrome Downloads Settings

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Make sure your browser is updated .

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this towards the bottom of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Privacy and security.
steps.content: Click Privacy and security . This is in the left panel, underneath Autofill and passwords .

steps.title: Click Site settings.
steps.content: Click Site settings . This is in the right panel, towards the bottom of the page.

steps.title: Click Additional permissions.
steps.content: Click Additional permissions . You can find this underneath the Permissions header, below Embedded content . The menu will expand.

steps.title: Click Automatic downloads.
steps.content: Click Automatic downloads . A new page will open.

steps.title: Select a new option.
steps.content: Select a new option. By default, you will have Sites can ask to automatically download multiple files . This option can save you time by allowing websites to download related files in one go. [1] X Research source To change this, select Don't allow sites to automatically download multiple files . To stop specific sites from automatically downloading multiple files, click Add next to this option and enter the website URL . To allow specific sites to automatically download multiple files, click Add next to this option and enter the website URL.

steps.title: Open Google Chrome.
steps.content: Open Google Chrome. Make sure your browser is updated.

steps.title: Click ⋮.
steps.content: Click ⋮ . This is in the top-right corner of the window.

steps.title: Click Settings.
steps.content: Click Settings . You can find this towards the bottom of the pop-up menu.

steps.title: Click Downloads.
steps.content: Click Downloads . This is in the left panel, underneath Languages .

steps.title: Click Change.
steps.content: Click Change . A pop-up window will open.

steps.title: Select a new save location.
steps.content: Select a new save location. Use the pop-up window to find a new location . Click Select Folder when you're finished. If you want to specify a new save location for each download, toggle on Ask where to save each file before downloading .
